11.content:
You wake up in the morning and let out a loud yawn. You make your way down to the dining hall to see that Madeline, Thomas, and your good friend Sarina are sitting at the table already. You sit down next to Sarina and Richard serves you your favorite breakfast meal: pancakes with a side of bacon strips and orange juice.
"Wow, Richard, these look better than usual." you say.
"I know," Richard replied. "It's a new recipe that I'm trying out. Thanks."
"Typical freeloader." King Thomas mumbled under his breath. Queen Madeline pinches Thomas's ear and he tries to contain his cry of pain.

"So, [your name]," Sarina said. "I was wondering if you wanted to take a walk through the garden with me."
"That sounds nice. I'd love to." you reply. "As long as your parents are okay with it."
Thomas was about to object, but Madeline shot him a deadly glare.
"We have no problem with it at all, dear." Madeline says sweetly, as if she had never shot a piercing glare to her husband.

As you and Sarina finish breakfast and go outside, Madeline decides to have a chat with Thomas.
"Why do you hate [your name] so much, honey. It's obvious that Sarina is very fond of him." she inquires.
"I know," the king replies. "But it's not him personally, I just can't trust Sarina around boys yet."
"Thomas, Sarina is seventeen years old. She can handle herself just fine. And [your name] is a responsible, and caring young man. You've nothing to worry about." Madeline reassures him.
"I guess your right." Thomas says, finally relenting.

Meanwhile, you and Sarina were taking a nice walk in the garden. You two pass by Felicia watering the plants and make small talk with her before continuing.
"You know, I've never noticed how beautiful the garden was." you say. "It's like I'm seeing it for the first time."
"Is there anything else that's beautiful here to you?" Sarina asks, trying to flirt.
"I dunno, what?" you ask back, oblivious of Sarina's intentions.
"I meant me, silly!" she says with a cute giggle.
"Oh, right." you say, feeling stupid.

You and Sarina sit down on a bench in the garden and talk for awhile.
"Listen [your name]," Sarina finally says. "there's something I've been meaning to tell you, but I've always been too nervous to say it. I................. I...................... I love you. I love you more than words can describe. When I first met you, I thought we would just be friends, but now I see that I want more than that. I want to be your girlfriend!"
You were shocked! There was no other way to describe it. You had no idea that Sarina felt so strongly about you. She then puts her, soft, furry hands on your shoulders and looks at you with love in her beautiful, blue cat eyes. As her lips get closer to yours she finally says to you: "Be my prince."
Sarina then gives you a soft, deep, passionate kiss upon your lips, and all sorts of sensations run through you. When she finally pulls away, the beautiful princess Sarina looks into your eyes again and gives you a big hug. As she purred in your ear, she whispers: "I love you so much."

Well, what are you gonna say?

You realize that Sarina dfidn't know that it was you who saved her due to the fact that she was still blindfolded. 12121.content:
Sarina had just disappeared into her room. Just as the door clicked shut, you let out a massive breath you didn't know you were holding. It had been an interesting day so far. Getting rejected, saving the Princess from some local scum, and making amends with said Princess as a result. And the best part, the increasing chance Sarina might truly like you as well. A smile crosses your face at this thought.

Maybe this could work, maybe we can truly be toget....

"BOY!"

The sound of a booming voice nearly caused you to leap out of your skin. Turning to face the source, your blood soon ran cold in your veins. Standing twenty away down the corridor, was the King himself.

King Thomas.

He struck such an imposing figure. Half a foot taller than yourself, he stood proud and powerful as any good king should. He wore brown leather boots with black leggings. A red tunic was complemented with a black & gold colored cloak. Fashioned to his hip was a steel sword that had been polished until it glowed as bright as the Sun. A fitting contrast to the blood soaked history of warfare you were certain it possessed. His fur was a deep chocolate brown, the hair atop his head a sleek black shade as dark as coal. Covering said hair was a crown of a style the people of the kingdom referred to as "modest" in taste. An emerald and ruby encrusted affair across three rings along the main body. It was a sight to make anyone feel small and vulnerable.

And you've faced it everyday for the past four years.

"Y-yes your Majesty?!" you began.

"Was that you just exiting my daughter's bed chambers?" he asked sternly.

"I..uh...well, it's not quite what you'd expect." you began, stammering uncontrollably.

"Not what I'd expect? Then tell me what I'd expect young human, or perhaps it is my eyes failing me in my advancing age. Is that what I expect?"

"N-n-n-no! Uh, no your majesty!" you said.

"It's nothing to worry about Father."

Both of you turned to face the interruption. Standing in the doorway, concealed behind the wooden door of her room, was Sarina. She must've been washing up as her fur looked clean and damp. You quickly deduced the real reason she was still mostly behind the door was due to a possible lack of clothing at that moment.

It took all your willpower to stay focused and conceal the rising amount of red on your cheeks.

"The two of us were walking in the town square this morning when a passing cart soaked me head to toe in wet mud. Dear [Your Name] was kind enough to assist me in returning to my room to change, lest I catch a fever or ruin the Castle floor's with mud and filth. You know how mother wouldn't approve." Sarina explained.

"Well?" the King asked, turning to face you.

"It is true your Majesty, Sarina and myself were in town this morning. We had only just returned mere moments before your arrival." you said. Not entirely lying.

The King's gazed moved from you, to Sarina, and back to you. Scanning and judging every inch of your being. After what seemed like a few centuries had passed, the King's shoulders relaxed, his gaze softening. You certainly did so as well.

"Very well. I humbly thank you for helping my daughter with her predicament. You honor your family well in continuing to aid our fair kingdom young human." he said before bowing. You did so as well, both out of respect and slight bewilderment.

"I will see you at dinner Sarina, I have other matters to attend."

King Thomas swiftly turned and departed down the corridor, quickly disappearing from sight. Sarina looked to you for a moment, gave you a quick wink and a smile, and vanished into her room. Leaving you all alone once more in the silent corridor.

"Sweet Hellfire..." you mutter in disbelief from recent events.

Figuring Sarina will still take some time getting dressed. You decide to see what your pals Richard and Felicia are up to this afternoon.

But which one first?

You decide......
12121.title: Just Then.........Royal Trouble.

12122.content:
After you ceased your silent celebration, you go to your room. As you got yourself comfortable in your bed, you put on some music and just start daydreaming about random crap.
As you were about to drift into sleep, you hear a knock on your door. You shut off the music and answer the door. You don't expect it to be Sarina, 'cause she's still changing. You hope it's not her father asking you where you and his daughter have been. Richard and Queen Madeline are sleeping in there respective rooms. That just leaves.....

"Oh, hi Felicia." you say to the girl standing in your doorway.

"Hey, [your name]. I just....... wanted to say hi." she says, sounding a little unsure of herself. "So.... how have you been?"

"Eh, same old stuff. Nothing new." you answer.

"Listen," she said. "I realized that we haven't really gotten to know each other in the four years that you've been here, so I was wondering if you'd want to go to the local diner. We can get a bite to eat and, you know, talk."

"Okay," you say. "It's not like I have anything planned tomorrow."

Felicia's eyes seem to brighten when she hears your response. "Great, I'll be ready to go at 12:30 tomorrow. G'night!" she finally says before she walks away.

The next morning, you see something on your nightstand. As your vision finally focuses, you recognize the object as a rose. You don't remember the rose being there before. You pick it up to see a note attached to it. Your eyes widened at what the note said.

To [your name]
You're the one object of my affection.
Every night when I go to sleep, it's you I think about.
I can't spend one day away from you,
because I've always loved you.

You see that the writer of the note signed her name at the bottom.
Who wrote the note?

In the four years you have lived here, you have learned one thing about furries, specifically the females, and that is when it comes to competing for affection, they can get very violent, very quickly. If Sarina found out that Felicia wanted you, they would probably both end up in the hospital, not to mention she would likely never speak to you again.

But then she would probably want to set another date some other time, and you couldn;t keep blowing her off, or she would get suspicious.

Your turn and see Felicia waving to you from a booth in the corner.You take a seat across from her as she smiles at you. "So, did you get my note this morning?" she asks with a grin like the Chesire Cat.


"Yeah, about that......" You saym, but are interupted as a waitress brings your your menus. "Order whatever you want." Says Felicia. "I'm buying." Oh perfect, you think to yourself, now she's buying me lunch. That's only gonna make things worse.


You hold your menu in front of your face, pretending to read. 1212222.content:
You were on the verge of a panic attack when you hear someone's voice.

"Well, well, well. What do we have here?" the voice says. You had your eyes closed, but you knew for sure that the voice did not belong to Sarina, or any other female for that matter.

"Richard!" Felicia exclaims. "What are you doing here?"

"Chill, Felicia." Richard says. "I was just getting a bite to eat when I saw you two here. What's going on?"

"Well, if you must know," Felicia says, "[your name] and I are on a date."

That four-letter word repeated itself in your head. Richard notices the panicked look on your face.

"Felicia, can I talk to [your name] in private for a second?" he asks.

"Fine," she answers. "but don't take too long."

"Yeah, yeah." Richard said. He was a year older than Felicia, so he wasn't too fond of the fact that someone younger that him was telling him what to do.

Later, in the men's room.....

"Dude, what are you doing on a date with Felicia?" he asks, confused "I thought Sarina was your dream girl. You're not thinking of juggling two chicks, are you?"

"Of course not!" you say. "What had happened was, Felicia asked me to go to the diner with her last night, and I thought it was just as friends, but then this morning I found a love note from her on my nightstand."

"Damn." Richard says. "You are in trouble. You're lucky that I'm here."

"Does that mean you'll help me out?" you ask.

"Sure. All you need to do is let her down gently before you guys order your food." he explains. "This way, she wouldn't have spent money on you."

"Got it, thanks!" you say.

"Where would you be without me?" Richard asks.

"Dead." you answer.

You get back to your seat, and Felicia is happy to see you.

"Great, you're back. What were you two doing?" she asks.

"Nothing important." you say, trying to change the subject. "Felicia, there's something that I have to tell you."

"I'm all ears." she says.

You take a deep breath. This was gonna be hard. "Look, Felicia. I think there's a little... misunderstanding."

She tilts her head in confusion. "What do you mean?"

"When I accepted your invitation to come here, I thought that we were just going as friends, but then when I read your note, I didn't want to say anything at first because I didn't want to hurt your feelings. It's not because of you, it's just that... I'm with Sarina."
You were looking down the whole time, and when you looked up at Felicia...

12122222.title: Sad or Mad?

121222221.content:
For a moment, Felicia sat there, dimbfounded. The fact that the object of her affection had already been taken had it her like a freight train, momentarily stunning her. "Felicia?" You snap your fingers in front of her face. She blinks and says, "Oh. Well.....I...I....guess I was too late." You nod. "Yes, you were. I'm sorry, but Sarina is the one I love. I hope we can still be friends."


She nodded slowly, a tear rolling down her cheek. "Hey, if it would make you feel better, I'll buy lunch for the both of us." You offer. Felcia doesn't answer. Instead, she just buries her face in her hands, and quietly sobs.


You reach across the table and lay your hand on Felcia's shoulder. "If it's any consolation, if Sarina wasn't around, I go for you in a heartbeat." You say. Felicia looks up at you, her eyes streaked with tears. "Really?" She asks. You nod.


Your waitress comes back with a pen and pad of paper. "Are you ready to order?" She asks. You looked at Felicia, then back at the waitress. "On second thought, we're not hungry." You and Felicia both get up and walk out, your arm around her shoulder.


For the entire walk back to the castle, Felicia didn't say a word. She just stared at the ground with a sad look on her face. You tried to comfort her, but she wouldn't respond, so you don't know if you did anything to help.


You get back to the castle, and Felicia suddenly makes a break for her room. You figured it would be best to just leave her alone to cry in peace. You decide not to tell Sarina about what happend, better she didn't know her best friend tried to steal her new boyfriend.


Felcia didn't come to dinner that night, and you didn't see her the next day either. Richard said that this was how all women reacted to being dumped (if you could call it that) and she would eventually get over it. You really hpoed he was right.


That night you decided to go check on Felicia to make sure she was okay. You knocked on her door and it slowly swung on it's hinges, opening into her room. Felicia was nowhere to be seen, but you noticed her desk lamp was on, and her diary was laying open ubder it.


You knew you really shouldn't read it. but you had to know if she was feeling better about you rejecting her. You looked at the most recent page and immediately ran out of the room and through the hallways to stop Felicia.


What was it she wrote?

Dear Diary,

While I have been really depressed since that day at the diner, I’ve seen a solution to my problems. [Your name] said that if Sarina wasn’t around, he would go for me in a heartbeat. Sarina may be my best friend, but all is fair in love and war. So tonight, I plan to spike her tea with poison, so that the only girl that [your name] has his eyes on will be me.

Oh great. You tried to put Felicia at ease only to have it backfire in the form of her taking what you said WAY too seriously. It was already 8:00. For all you know, Sarina could be dead already. The very thought makes you cringe in fear. You rush down to the kitchen and see Felicia about to leave with a tray with two cups of tea. Sarina and Felicia had this best friend tradition where they had tea together every night.

“Felicia, wait!” you exclaim.

“Hey, you.” she says with an unusual smile on her face. There was definitely something wrong. She’s been missing for almost 24 hours, and now she’s all bright and bubbly? Hell no.

“I know you spiked Sarina’s tea.” you say with a very serious tone.

“What are you talking about?” she said, her voice containing a defensive tone.

“Please don’t do this.” you plead. “You won’t be able to live with the guilt.”

“I have no idea what you’re talking about.” Felicia says.

In your mind, you frantically try to figure out how to get her to drop the “Miss Innocent” act. Then you figured it out. You walk over to Felicia, picking up one of the teacups, hoping that it was the one with the poison. You put the cup to your mouth, as if you were going to actually drink it.

“Don’t drink that!” Felicia suddenly yells in panic. Got ‘er.

“Why would you do this?” you say. “Sarina’s your best friend, isn’t she?!”

“She may be my friend, but I will do anything for you.” she says. “I’ve loved you long before she did.”

“I know I said that if I wasn’t in love with Sarina, then I would go for you, but that doesn’t mean that you can kill her!” you say, starting to get angry.

“Don’t you remember that Sarina used to hate you?” she says. “She only started liking you when you saved her from that creep in the city! I fell in love with you a year after you moved here!”

Wow. She really was in love with you.

“Felicia, this is a life-and-death situation.” you say. “I will stop you if I have to.”

“You can’t stop me!” she screams.

Just then…

122.content:
You could hardy believe your eyes, the Princess of the Kingdom, Sarina, the beautiful cat girl who had taken your heart, was in grave danger! Jumping to your feet, you dashed over to the stone railing of the castle' garden ready to leap over and into action.

But...you paused. Something felt off. You couldn't place the feeling, but something was gnawing away at your heart. It ached, burned, and left you feeling cold and empty on the inside. Suddenly it began to dawn on you why you were feeling this way, Sarina had broken your heart, and your were furious. The two of you had lived together for years, all the time while your heart was growing fonder, she still seemed distant and cold.

Perhaps you could've lived with that, a lifetime in the "friendzone", but after today, after such a hostile confrontation at the exact moment you were ready to come clean with your feelings.....

You clenched your fingers angrily. The sound of a scream however broke you from your thoughts, pushing you to quickly begin to hop over the railing once more. But again, you stopped.

Why should you care? She obviously doesn't care about you...

The little voice inside your head had you pounding the castle garden's outer railing in frustration. There was no time to be having this argument, something had to be done!

But your heart was conflicted, on one hand you knew you had to save her, at the very least it was the right thing to do, regardless of how you felt. She may have been the Princess, but more importantly, she was innocent of this, and certainly didn't deserve this kind of fate. But still, she had carelessly broken your heart, and a part of you wanted her to pay.

But you still loved her, don't you?

Well, dear hero, DO you?

1221.content:
Yes, yes I DO!!!

With fire brewing in your heart, you hurled yourself over the stone railing and into the street. Not once paying the slightest bit of attention to all the honking cars, and bewildered pedestrians you ran past. As you approached the alley Sarina was dragged into, you could see down the long passageway just enough to catch a glimpse of a large figure disappearing around a corner and into a smaller side alley. Breaking into a run to head into the aisle, you stopped briefly just long enough to grab a sizable board of flat wood that was roughly the same size as a baseball bat.

"Perfect!" you exclaimed.

As you rounded the corner of the smaller alleyway, your blood grew cold in your veins. Forcibly pressed up against the wall high enough her feet were off the ground, was Sarina. Pining her to the wall with one fat hand on her throat and another holding her right arm against the wall, was a filthy, greasy, slime ball brute of a human. He was easily a head taller than you, and three times your size in sheer girth. He was wearing a brown, tattered leather coat, stained jeans, and a ratty pair of boots. A feeling of cold rage and disgust blossomed in your rib cage when the greasy man slowly pushed his filthy, bald headed, unshaven face closer to Sarina's lips, a vile smile creeping across his features when Sarina flinched backwards with revulsion.

With great relief, you were happy to see Sarina wasn't much worse for wear. There were no scratches or marks to speak of, but her stylish, crimson turtleneck shirt had a few tears in the fabric, while her snow white leggings were now stained with dirt and mud. Your heart sank a little at the sight, as you always thought she looked beautiful in that outfit. The way the crimson shirt highlighted her jet black fur and moonlight yellow eyes, and the way her white leggings fit snug and tight against her shapely form and sharp hips......n-not that you looked or anything!!

"Hello kitty kitty, won't you give us a kissy kiss?" The man cooed slimily.

The look Sarina gave him could've turned a person into stone. "Let go of me sir, and I promise you the kiss of death will be satisfactory," Sarina spat back.

"Hehe,I like me one with a bit of spunk...." said the man with a chortle.

"Oi! Tiny Tim!" You called out at the top of your lungs, running full tilt toward the massive scumbag.

The instant the greasy man's head turned to see who had called out, was the same instant the wooden board collided with his head with enough force to shatter the board into splinters and knock the greasy brute into a daze. As the man staggered backwards, Sarina fell to ground hard on her rump, coughing violently as she rubbed her sore throat. Throwing the now useless remains of the board away, you dropped to your knees to check to see if Sarina was alright, thankful your heart had stayed strong and true enough to convince you to rescue her.

I don't think I could've lived with myself if I didn't...

"Y-you?!...*cough*...What are..*cough*..you doing *cough* here?!" she wheezed, her brilliant golden eyes gazing up at you in wonder and surprise.

Gingerly helping the royal cat back onto her feet, you were about to answer her question when the sound of furious cursing could be heard coming from behind you. "No time, just go!" you exclaimed, pushing her away.

"But what about..." she argued.

"Go! Please!" you yelled.

She wanted to protest, you could see it in her eyes, but she did what she was told and ran. You watched with relief as her long, majestic tail disappeared back into the main alleyway. So distracted were you by Sarina's bewitching form, you didn't see the sheer cannonball of a fist that was coming at you from a now recovered, attacker.

Strange spots of bright color filled your vision as the entire left side of your head erupted with pain like a volcano, launching you sideways straight into a pair of metal trashcans. You knew this man had to have been strong, but to actually feel his strength was an experience you could've done without. The man was just about to swing another punch downward but you quickly blocked it by use a metal trashcan lid, which crumpled like tinfoil from the blow. As the man drew back to punch again, you delivered a quick kick to the man's knee, distracting him just long enough to allow the chance to drop the lid straight on his head, hard.

As the man fell to the ground in a heap, you hurriedly scrambled back up to full height to make a break for it, only to have your feet pulled out from under you when the man grabbed your ankle. Landing hard on the ground on your stomach, you swiftly turned round to find the man pulling you back toward him by your ankles.Despite your kicks to his head, the large climbed up to full height with both of his hands on your neck, where he began to squeeze with the strength of a bear. Blackness was beginning to envelope your vision as you desperately tried to break free. Failing that, you resorted to one last option of kicking the man square in the groin.

A loud cry of agony echoed across the alleyway as the man tensed up from the blow. Recovering yourself, you broke free of his hold and began to fight back, throwing punches left and right at the man's face, throat and shoulders. Unfortunately, the big brute drew into himself and was easily shaking off whatever damage you could throw. Quick as a whip, the man grabbed one of arms, leaving you exposed so he could bring round his other arm to lethally drop you to the ground. Thick, globs of blood pooled on the ground as you coughed harshly. At that moment a dark figure suddenly loomed over head. You looked up in horror as the greasy faced man lifted up his thick leg high into the air, ready to crush your skull into the pavement. Closing your eyes and whispering a prayer, one final thought fluttered through your mind as you awaited your demise.

I love you Sarina....I only wish you knew how much.....

Just as the man was about to deliver the killing blow, a loud sound grabbed both his and your attention. Suddenly, the man began to scream and shout while twisting frantically about in place. Opening your eyes cautiously, you found yourself in awe at the sight before you where the man was being attacked by....

The next morning you wake up and examine the area where Sarina bit you. The wound had closed up, but the area around it was reddish. You think that I'll go away. On your way to the dining hall, something possessed you to go to Richard and request a different breakfast than usual.


"Milk and fish treats?" he asks in disbelief. "That's what Sarina and Felicia usually eat for breakfast. Are you sure."


When he asks you that, you realized what you just requested. Normally, you would gag when you tasted a fish treat, and you're allergic to milk, too.


"I think so..." you say.

At breakfast, Sarina wonders why you have the same breakfast as her. "Did Richard actually make a mistake, for once?" she whispers

The two of you find Madeline in the throne room and tell her your story. She seemed suspicious as to how you actually contracted this condition, but regardless, she tells you both to follow her. She leads you to the library, and begins scanning the shelves.



"So what exactly is happening to (your name)?" Asked Sarina.

From what I remember, furries have a sort of mutagenic bacteria in their mouths, that if transferred to a human, causes them to slowly take on the characterisitics of the species of furry that bit them."

She reaches into her pocket and pulls out a small mirror. You look into it, and see that your eyes have turned yellow, and your pupils are slits! At first you were shocked to see that aleady, this affliction, wahtever it was, had begun to alter you physically. As you look away from the mirror, and back to Madeline, you say...

Madeline lets out a sigh of relief. "Oh, thank goodness!" she says, walking towards you and Sarina hugging the both of you tightly. She then turns to her husband and gives him a deathly glare. "Thomas," she says with a bone-chilling tone. "I think you owe someone an apology."

Thomas looks off to the side, not wanting to look his wife in the eye.


"I really don't get you, Thomas," Madeline continues. "[Your name]'s parents were are best friends, and you and his father were inseparable, yet you treat their son with such disdain, when he's done nothing to give you a reason to do so! You ought to be ashamed of yourself!"

142122211112211.title: Fessing Up

For a moment, you expected Thomas to stick to his stubborn old ways, but to your and Sarina's surprise, he sighs and says "You're right dear, I do owe (your name) an apology." Thomas walks up to you with a sincere look of regret on his face. "(Your name), I'm sorry. For everything. You can tell by the look on Thomas's face that he really meant everything he just said. While you were still somewhat mad at him, you were never the type to hold a grudge.

The two of you shake hands, and to your surprise, Thomas does something that he has never done before. He hugs you. "I hope you understand." "Dear!" Says Madeline as she smacks the back of Thomas's head. "I'm only joking!" Says Thomas, chuckling. You never thought Thomas had a sense of humor. Then, he turns to Sarina. "As for you young lady, there's still the matter of you starting this mess by lying to us."

Sarina never did anything to Richard, but he was a loyal friend, and he knew that Sarina needed to be taught a lesson.

Confused, Sarina goes to the bathroom to look at herself in the mirror and is shocked to see that her hair is where it's supposed to be, but her face looks like a clown's face. She finally put two and two together and screams out your name in anger.

If you go through with this, one of two things will happen: she'll either snitch to her parents, or do something totally embarrassing to you."

You feel you blood begin to boil in your veins as you continue to read Sarina's plan, until you finally snatch up the diary, and rush off to find Madeline, your fury giving you the speed of The Flash.

info.description:
You're just an average human, age 17. You've lived in a grand castle for about four years, but you're not the prince or a servant, just a resident. Lucky for you, your parents are real tight with the king and queen, so you got hooked up after your folks passed. Here's the twist: the castle is full of anthro cats! This Romance/Comedy/Erotica story revolves around you and the castle's princess, Sarina, who is just your age. You choose the path you want to take.

CHARACTERS (OTHER THAN YOU)

Princess Sarina - 17 - The castles princes, your main love interest. Black fur, long flowing black hair, about your height.

Queen Madeline - 39 - The queen of the castle, and Sarina's open-minded mother. She's very supportive of you and welcomed you into the castle with open arms when you came. Grey fur, curly red hair, about three inches taller than you.

King Thomas - 41 - The king of the castle, and is very protective of his daughter, Sarina. He doesn't trust you very much, and you can't help to mouth him off sometimes. Dark brown fur, short, black hair, about seven inches taller than you.

Richard - 19 - The castle's head chef and your best friend, gives you good advice. Light brown fur, shaggy black hair, about your height.

Felicia - 18 - The castle's maid and Sarina's best friend, she's pretty good friends with you, too. White fur, medium length blond hair, about an inch shorter than you.

Please make long, well written contributions. Remember, romance is the main element of the story, but there can also be erotic elements too. Enjoy!
